summary: CI test suite experiences intermittent timeouts during script execution with ERR_SCRIPT_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT errors. The issue was partially mitigated by increasing isolateExecutionTimeout from 100ms to 400ms, but rare flakes still occur under resource constraints.
userImpact: Developers experience intermittent CI failures that are not related to actual code quality, causing unreliable test results and build delays.
rootCause: Script execution timeout due to test concurrency and machine resource constraints. 5-second limit with individual script timeout threshold too aggressive.
proposedFix: Increase isolateExecutionTimeout threshold and potentially reduce test concurrency or allocate stronger CI machines.
workaround: Increased isolateExecutionTimeout from 100ms to 400ms to reduce frequency of timeouts.
resolutionDetails: Partially resolved by increasing isolateExecutionTimeout to 400ms. Rare flakes may still occur but deemed acceptable with current infrastructure limitations.
